title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:38 <DrLou> has quit  
01:52 <abusenius> has quit  
02:46 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
02:57 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
03:46 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
04:24 <DrLou> has quit  
04:44 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
04:44 <DrLou> has quit  
07:43 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:19 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:27 <finbrein> has joined #xwiki  
13:31 <@sdumitriu> xwikibot was down this morning, so I can't see this in the logs: did anybody talk about the release? M2 is supposed to happen today  
13:32 <vmassol> I just mentioned that today is supposed to be release day  
13:32 <vmassol> we need to decide what we do  
13:33 <vmassol> release it as is and it's not a problem that there isn't much done in 3.1 (which is fine for me). The main work will be in 3.2 then  
13:33 <vmassol> or postpone the release  
13:33 <@sdumitriu> So far the roadmap features didn't progress that much  
13:34 <vmassol> in general I'm way more for time boxing  
13:34 <@sdumitriu> M1 was busy with the git move  
13:34 <@sdumitriu> And for M2 I've been busy with the Ia?i visit  
13:34 <vmassol> we can present 3.1 as a stabilization release  
13:34 <vmassol> s/can/could/  
13:35 <vmassol> if we postpone it's going to be a long postponing IMO  
13:35 <@sdumitriu> +1  
13:35 <vmassol> I'd say at least 3 weeks  
13:35 <+Denis> +1  
13:35 <vmassol> +1 for what? :)  
13:35 <@sdumitriu> So, cjdelisle: Are you available to do the release today?  
13:35 <+Denis> git move is anyway a big move  
13:35 <@sdumitriu> +1 it's going to be long  
13:35 <+Denis> and it is worse a release  
13:35 <@sdumitriu> So -1 to postpone  
13:35 <@sdumitriu> s/worse/worth  
13:35 <vmassol> ok good  
13:35 <@sdumitriu> Right?  
13:36 <+Denis> right  
13:36 <@sdumitriu> I don't like "stabilization"  
13:36 <@sdumitriu> How about "progress"?  
13:36 <@sdumitriu> Move to JDK6  
13:37 <@sdumitriu> Upgrade Hibernate  
13:37 <@sdumitriu> Upgrade Lucene  
13:37 <@sdumitriu> Upgrade everything  
13:37 <vmassol> sounds good  
13:37 <@sdumitriu> Switch to @Inject  
13:37 <@sdumitriu> (JSR something)  
13:38 <+Denis> yes, sounds good as well  
13:38 <vmassol> 303  
13:38 <vmassol> 330  
13:38 <vmassol> sergiu: want to send email? or should I do it?  
13:39 <@sdumitriu> I don't want to, but I can if you tell me to  
13:39 <vmassol> ok I'll do it  
13:39 <+Denis> I am working a the latest build for my next project to be release in june, and I will probably report and I hope fix some issue with latest feature in a XEM instalation  
13:40 <+Denis> I have already found some issue in activity stream I think, I need more testing to report  
14:21 <@cjdelisle> Hi vmassol  
14:21 <vmassol> cjdelisle: hi  
14:21 <@cjdelisle> What do we want to do re storage, I think that if we turn down the max\_allowed\_packet we can repeat the problem on old versions.  
14:22 <@cjdelisle> Do we want to repeat it then do the same things on 3.0 to show that it did happen but it cannot anymore?  
14:29 <+lucaa> vmassol: build of platform is still failing on ci: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/132/console it seems to be a pom version declaration issue  
14:29 <+lucaa> (didn't know if you're on it or not, just wanting to see the enterprise tests results)  
14:30 <vmassol> lucaa: tmortagne looked at it last friday and couldn't reproduce it locally although he could on the hudson agent  
14:30 <vmassol> I also don't have it locally  
14:30 <+lucaa> so noone is on it?  
14:30 <vmassol> I'm on customer support  
14:30 <+lucaa> ok  
14:33 <+tmortagne> lucaa: I doubt anyone is on it, I can reproduce on agent1 but I can't find why there is this issue, the commons pom contains the version and I'm sure the build use the right one since I deleted all the other versions  
14:33 <+lucaa> could it be the maven version on ci?  
14:33 <+lucaa> I have 2.2.1 on local, and I can build fine  
14:33 <+lucaa> I mean, so far  
14:39 <+tmortagne> lucaa: no it's not maven version I tried the exact same version  
14:40 <+tmortagne> and pretty much the same environment since I'm on ubuntu and agent1 on debian iff I remember well  
14:40 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:41 <+lucaa> ok, what does this mean here?  
14:41 <+lucaa>   <parent>  
14:41 <+lucaa>     <groupId>org.xwiki.commons</groupId>  
14:41 <+lucaa>     <artifactId>xwiki-commons-pom</artifactId>  
14:41 <+lucaa>     <version>3.1-SNAPSHOT</version>  
14:41 <+lucaa>     <relativePath>../xwiki-commons/xwiki-commons-pom</relativePath>  
14:41 <+lucaa>   </parent>  
14:41 <+lucaa> especially the relative path one...  
14:41 <+lucaa> is that supposed to work on all systems?  
14:43 <+lucaa> maybe that's where the pom inheritance doesn't work properly?  
14:43 <+tmortagne> lucaa: yes but anyway it's just a shortcut to speed up things  
14:43 <+lucaa> but for example doesn't work on my local  
14:43 <+tmortagne> if relativePath is not good in your environment then mavne will download it  
14:44 <+lucaa> ok  
14:45 <+tmortagne> and in agent1 case it downloads it  
14:45 <vmassol> cjdelisle: checking with ludovic/florin to see what's needed from us on the storage thing  
14:45 <+tmortagne> (I removed it from local repository and I find it after the build is done)  
14:45 <+lucaa> ok...  
14:46 <+tmortagne> the "good" things is that I can reproduce the failure bu hand on agent1 but I could not find what is the real difference with my environment where it does not fail  
14:47 <vmassol> lucaa: maven automatically looks up one directroy up when looking up for parent poms (unless you specified relativepath)  
14:47 <vmassol> (this allows to build locally without connection to a remote repo)  
14:52 <+lucaa> also, I have a compilation error when building platform locally  
14:52 <+lucaa> [ERROR] BUILD FAILURE  
14:52 <+lucaa> [INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------  
14:52 <+lucaa> [INFO] Compilation failure  
14:52 <+lucaa> /home/lucaa/xwiki/src/xwiki-trunks/platform/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-aether/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/repository/aether/internal/plexus/DefaultPlexusComponentManager.java:[47,19] logger is already defined in org.xwiki.extension.repository.aether.internal.plexus.DefaultPlexusComponentManager  
14:55 <vmassol> indeed fixing  
14:55 <vmassol> must have done a bad merge  
14:56 <vmassol> fixed  
14:57 <+lucaa> and could I change the relative path of the parent pom of xwiki-platform to a correct one? just to see what happens?   ( tmortagne? )  
14:57 <vmassol> lucaa: on the agent?  
14:58 <vmassol> (because the value is a correct one - at least the one we want)  
14:58 <+lucaa> why do we want that value?  
14:58 <+lucaa> it doesn't make sense on my machine, nor on the agent  
14:58 <+lucaa> I think  
14:58 <+lucaa> lemme double check  
14:58 <vmassol> it's the one corresponding to a git clone of all git repos at the same level  
14:59 <vmassol> (which makes sense)  
14:59 <+lucaa> what I have is a clone of xwiki-trunks  
14:59 <+lucaa> and commons folder name is not xwiki-commons, but plain simple commons  
14:59 <+tmortagne> lucaa: xwiki-trunks is actually wrong and supposed to be modified  
15:00 <+lucaa> just like platform  
15:00 <+tmortagne> (though it was already done)  
15:00 <+lucaa> maybe it was after I cloned...  
15:00 <vmassol> sergiu said he fixed it AFAIR  
15:00 <+lucaa> ah right I see  
15:00 <vmassol> sdumitriu?  
15:00 <+tmortagne> yep it's modified  
15:00 <vmassol> sdumitriu: nm  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> Yes, it should be xwiki-commons now  
15:02 <@sdumitriu> But fetching xwiki-trunks won't delete commons, it will just create a new xwiki-commons next to it  
15:02 <@sdumitriu> It's the developer's task to use the correct directory and remove the old one  
15:13 <+lucaa> cool, xwiki-platform is building now  
15:13 <+lucaa> it seems  
15:13 <+lucaa> thanks, if anyone did anything to it  
15:15 <+lucaa> there are a lot of checksum failures though  
15:15 <+lucaa> on downloading stull  
15:15 <+lucaa> stuff  
15:15 <+lucaa> let's hope it's gonna be an up to date build, though  
15:20 <lucaa> has quit  
15:22 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <+tmortagne> lucaa: you can use -U to be extra sure it download the latest snapshots  
15:28 <+lucaa> something's a bit concerning with the csrf tests  
15:28 <+lucaa> it's 8 tests which take 409 seconds to run  
15:29 <+lucaa> on hudson, which is supposed to be a good machine  
15:35 <@cjdelisle> it's a problem with lack of random entropy  
15:36 <@cjdelisle> the fix is to provide fake random which I did for most of crypto  
15:38 <+tmortagne> and no hudson is not supposed to be a good machine  
15:39 <@cjdelisle> it's a 3 core amd, IMO it's underutilized because we don't have maven3 with threading.  
15:39 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: agents are 3 core amd ?  
15:40 <+tmortagne> that's pretty new then  
15:40 <+tmortagne> it's used to be the cheapest OVH dedicated server  
15:41 <+tmortagne> agent1 at least still seems to be a kimsufi OVH offer which i'm pretty sure is not a 3 core  
15:43 <+tmortagne> or maybe we did not take the cheepest kimsufi offert actually  
15:43 <+tmortagne> s/offert/offer/  
15:44 <@cjdelisle> 3 core phenom with about 4G of ram IIRC  
15:45 <+lucaa> tmortagne: it's better than my local I meant  
15:45 <+tmortagne> indeed just seen there is 3 core, I tough we took something lower that that since as you said it was really not needed  
15:45 <@cjdelisle> heh get me another dsl line I can throw some real muscle at the build ;)  
15:46 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: in any case +1 for maven 3 when we upgrade java version, maven 3 move was already voted anyway  
15:47 <@cjdelisle> yea, then we can just login and run top while increasing the number of threads until it starts swap threashing  
16:02 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: what do you mean by "Upgrade Lucene" ? Lucene 3.x ?  
16:02 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
16:03 <+tmortagne> you are aware that this mean rewriting most of the search part of the plugin since the API used does not exists in Lucene 3.x anymore ?  
16:04 <+tmortagne> specifically org.apache.lucene.search.Hits  
16:06 <+tmortagne> asking seems that seems pretty big for the time left for 3.1  
16:10 <+tmortagne> (maybe they provide a kind lucene-legacy with some old API but did not seen it when I search the first time)  
16:47 <+lucaa> there's still a detail I don't understand about ci  
16:47 <+lucaa> I look at this build, which seemed to be fine:  
16:47 <+lucaa> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/134/  
16:47 <+lucaa> but none of the downstream builds didn't run  
16:47 <+lucaa> is it because of the test failures?  
16:49 <+tmortagne> when a maven project have test failure it's not deployed AFAIK  
16:49 <+tmortagne> but for the build trigering i'm not sure  
16:50 <+tmortagne> I guess it expect to not have anything new since it's not deployed so it does not build downstream  
16:51 <+tmortagne> but it's not right in case of something like platform since this failure=not deployed is module by module so most of the platform has been deployed  
16:52 <+tmortagne> lucaa: or I missuderstood what you mean by downstream builds  
16:53 <+lucaa> enterprise mainly :)  
16:53 <+tmortagne> or so I did understood  
16:53 <+tmortagne> so indeed it's probably because of test but I'm not sure (at least I don't see any other reason if XE really did not built)  
16:55 <+lucaa> and another mistery is what are all these modules under platform marked as "didn't ru"  
16:55 <+lucaa> "didn't run"  
16:55 <@cjdelisle> looks like a failed build but I didn't see any red ball  
16:55 <+tmortagne> don't know, when you look at console it indicate everything has been run  
16:56 <+lucaa> ah, they're disabled modules  
16:56 <+lucaa> it seems  
16:56 <+lucaa> here http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/modules  
16:56 <+lucaa> I guess those are the old modules (before the reorganization of sources) but I don't understand exactly why are they still there  
16:57 <+tmortagne> ha atcullay it's not really disabled, it's old module  
16:57 <+tmortagne> jenkins just kept them  
16:57 <+lucaa> they are in the disabled list...  
16:57 <+lucaa> can I delete them?  
16:57 <+tmortagne> i think there is a batch remove all disabled or something  
16:57 <vmassol> I'm removing them  
16:57 <+lucaa> ok  
16:57 <+lucaa> thank vmassol  
16:57 <vmassol> done  
16:58 <+lucaa> ah much better  
16:59 <+tmortagne> restarting agent2 since it seems to have xvnc issues  
17:00 <evalica> has quit  
17:09 <+tmortagne> vmassol: looks like JBossCacheCacheConfiguration is broken, there is a lot of error at XE startup on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/7252/console  
17:12 <+tmortagne> it's trying to load " xwiki.store.pagecache" file  
17:16 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:17 <vmassol> tmortagne: ys i've seen these errors but I assumed they were there before and not real "errors". I was planning to look at them a bit later  
17:17 <vmassol> so do you confirm they were not there before?  
17:19 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:22 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:58 <sburjan> has quit  
18:00 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:29 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
19:02 <arkub> has quit  
19:07 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:20 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
19:27 <lucaa> has quit  
19:42 <arkub> has quit  
19:48 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
19:53 <arkub> has quit  
20:54 <finbrein> has quit  
21:28 <Chami> has joined #xwiki  
21:32 <barbadosas> has joined #xwiki  
21:32 <barbadosas> hello there  
21:32 <@cjdelisle> hi  
21:32 <barbadosas> i'm trying to include a simple js file but i cant seem to get it to work  
21:33 <barbadosas> i found a threat in the mail archive  
21:33 <barbadosas> tried it both ways  
21:33 <@cjdelisle> how are you doing it?  
21:33 <barbadosas> as a skin in skin directory and now trying as an attached file  
21:33 <barbadosas> <script> language="javascript" src="${doc.getAttachmentURL('a.js')}"</script>  
21:33 <barbadosas> its in sandbox  
21:33 <barbadosas> and the file is attached to the sandbox  
21:34 <barbadosas> before {{velocity}} {{html}}  
21:34 <barbadosas> and after also  
21:34 <barbadosas> with /  
21:34 <@cjdelisle> it's not the "recommended way" but it ought to work  
21:34 <barbadosas> the recommended way would be with objects?  
21:35 <@cjdelisle> Objects of type JsSkinExtension IIRC  
21:35 <barbadosas> extensions?  
21:36 <@cjdelisle> create one, put your alert('hello'); inside of that, view the page containing it, and you should get your helloworld  
21:36 <barbadosas> so paste the code from the file to the new object and then include it with $xwiki.jsx.use(?  
21:37 <@cjdelisle> that should work  
21:37 <@cjdelisle> My stuff uses it so.. That will work :)  
21:37 <barbadosas> will i be able to use it dinamicly?  
21:37 <barbadosas> cause the idea is to create custom pdf file using javascript  
21:37 <barbadosas> i got it working on a simple server  
21:38 <barbadosas> now have to try to adapt to xwiki  
21:38 <barbadosas> when i say i got it working i dont mean i made the code  
21:38 <barbadosas> :D  
21:38 <@cjdelisle> do you know that the way you are using it is not working?  
21:39 <barbadosas> good question  
21:39 <barbadosas> i had problems including the file  
21:39 <@cjdelisle> I can only get you as far as your js code loads, after that it's up to you  
21:39 <barbadosas> so probably not sure at the oment  
21:39 <@cjdelisle> if you are not testing with firebug then you should be  
21:41 <barbadosas> can i mix velocity and java in the extension bit where the code goes?  
21:42 <@cjdelisle> if you use "interpreted" in the bottom then you can  
21:42 <@cjdelisle> but I assume you do understand the difference between "mixing velocity and js" and "using velocity to write js"  
21:43 <@cjdelisle> IE: you can't just pass a variable from js back to velocity  
21:43 <@sdumitriu> barbadosas: I noticed a typo in your paste:  
21:43 <@sdumitriu> <script> language="javascript" src="${doc.getAttachmentURL('a.js')}"</script>  
21:43 <@sdumitriu> <script language="javascript" src="${doc.getAttachmentURL('a.js')}"></script>  
21:43 <@sdumitriu> And actually:  
21:43 <@sdumitriu> <script type="text/javascript" src="${doc.getAttachmentURL('a.js')}"></script>  
21:44 <@cjdelisle> oops  
21:44 <@cjdelisle> how did I ever miss that one  
21:44 <barbadosas> aa yes, i copied from the mailing archieves  
21:45 <barbadosas> and those << were there  
21:45 <barbadosas> cjdelisle: i only need to pass the variable from velocity to java  
21:45 <barbadosas> sdumitriu: thank you  
21:45 <barbadosas> it works :)  
22:05 <Chami> hi  
22:05 <@sdumitriu> Hi Chami  
22:06 <Chami> sdumitriu: I've done xem-web-debug import to eclipse as the tutorial said  
22:06 <Chami> sdumitriu: but after I run it, xwiki is not found (404)  
22:07 <Chami> sdumitriu: I use apache tomcan 7.0  
22:07 <Chami> \*tomcat  
22:08 <@sdumitriu> Hm, tmortagne should know more about that  
22:09 <Chami> sdumitriu: ok, I'll ask him  
22:10 <Chami> sdumitriu: any suggestions to try now?  
22:11 <@sdumitriu> Well, normally I work with a standalone XE zip and start it with start\_xwiki\_debug.sh  
22:11 <@sdumitriu> And I connect to it from Eclipse after that  
22:13 <Chami> sdumitriu: is there any tutorial for your method?  
22:15 <@sdumitriu> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Debugging#HRemoteDebugging  
22:15 <@sdumitriu> But it's not needed most of it  
22:16 <@sdumitriu> First part is equivalent to running start\_xwiki\_debug  
22:16 <@sdumitriu> The important part starts with "Then, in your favorite IDE, open the XWiki project and run a remote debugging session"  
22:30 <vmassol> has quit  
23:08 <Chami> has left #xwiki  
23:23 <mflorea> has quit  
23:58 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki
